holidays.name: National Devil's Food Cake Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the rich, chocolatey, devilishly delicious dessert known as devil's food cake. Sink your teeth into layers of moist, dark chocolate cake with creamy frosting!
holidays.origin: This day was created by food enthusiasts to honor one of the most decadent chocolate cakes that originated in the United States during the early 20th century.
holidays.funFact: Devil's food cake gets its dark color from the use of cocoa powder and sometimes coffee, which enhances the chocolate flavor.

holidays.name: Endangered Species Day
holidays.description: An awareness day to spotlight the plight of endangered species worldwide and to encourage conservation efforts to protect animals and plants at risk of extinction.
holidays.origin: Established by the U.S. Congress in 2006 to raise awareness and promote action towards biodiversity conservation.

holidays.origin: Originated in the UK to commemorate the invention and evolution of timekeeping tools, reminding us not to be 'late' in appreciating time.
